info.name: Semicircular canal
info.description: The semicircular canals (horizontal, superior, posterior) are three half-circular, interconnected tubes that constitute the bony labyrinth of the inner ear.  Suspended within these bony canals is the membranous counterpart known as the semicircular ducts.  The ducts are filled with a fluid called endolymph, while they are surrounded by perilymph that fills the bony labyrinth.  With movements of the head, the hair cell receptors within the semicircular ducts detect movement of the endolymph and send a signal to the brain via the vestibular nerve.
